article.headline: Pepperdine 81, Bradley 80
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Glen McGowan scored 24 points and made a game-winning dunk with two seconds left to lift Pepperdine past Bradley 81-80 Saturday. Pepperdine's Shaun Davis rebounded after a miss by Bradley's Marcellus Sommerville with 20 seconds left and brought the ball up court. After letting the clock run below five seconds, Davis found a wide open McGowan under the basket for the winning score. McGowan was 9-for-10 from the field on the afternoon. Pepperdine (4-6) overcame a 16-point first-half deficit by shooting a season-high 50.9 percent (28-for-55) from the field, including 59.3 percent (16-for-27) in the second half. The Waves went on a 19-6 run over an eight-minute period in the first half to cut the Braves' lead to 36-35 with 1:30 remaining. Bradley led 40-37 at the half. Bradley's Phillip Gilbert led all scorers with 25 points and James Gillingham scored 24. The Braves (7-3) out-rebounded Pepperdine 37-29, led by Sommerville's 11. Sommerville also had 17 points. Alex Acker and Terrance Johnson had 15 points apiece for Pepperdine. Acker led the Waves with eight rebounds and five assists.
